00012 MillisecondUnit::MillisecondUnit()
00013         : DataspaceUnit("millisecond")
00014 {;}
00015 
00016 
00017 MillisecondUnit::~MillisecondUnit()
00018 {;}
00019                 
00020 
00021 void MillisecondUnit::convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output)
00022 {
00023         *outputNumArgs = 1;
00024         *output = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms);
00025 }
00026 
00027 
00028 void MillisecondUnit::convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00029 {
00030         *outputNumArgs = 1;
00031         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms, *input);
00032 }

00035 /***********************************************************************************************/
00036 SampleUnit::SampleUnit()
00037         : DataspaceUnit("sample")
00038 {
00039         // TODO: Do something a bit more legit with the sample rate -- need to actually know the real sample rate!
00040         sample_rate = (long)DEFAULT_SAMPLE_RATE;
00041         msr = double(sample_rate) / 1000.0;
00042         rmsr = 1.0 / msr;
00043 }
00044 
00045 
00046 SampleUnit::~SampleUnit()
00047 {;}
00048                 
00049                 
00050 void SampleUnit::convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output)
00051 {
00052         *outputNumArgs = 1;
00053         *output = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms) * rmsr;
00054 }
00055 
00056 
00057 void SampleUnit::convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00058 {
00059         *outputNumArgs = 1;
00060         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms, (*input * msr));
00061 }
00062

00064 /***********************************************************************************************/
00065 SecondUnit::SecondUnit()
00066         : DataspaceUnit("second")
00067 {;}
00068 
00069 
00070 SecondUnit::~SecondUnit()
00071 {;}
00072 
00073                 
00074 void SecondUnit::convertToNeutral(long inputNumArgs, t_atom *inputAtoms, long *outputNumArgs, double *output)
00075 {
00076         *outputNumArgs = 1;
00077         *output = atom_getfloat(inputAtoms) * 1000.0;
00078 }
00079 
00080 
00081 void SecondUnit::convertFromNeutral(long inputNumArgs, double *input, long *outputNumArgs, t_atom **outputAtoms)
00082 {
00083         *outputNumArgs = 1;
00084         atom_setfloat(*outputAtoms, *input * 0.001);
00085 }
00086 
00087 
00088 /***********************************************************************************************/
00089 TimeDataspace::TimeDataspace()
00090         : DataspaceLib("time", "millisecond")
00091 {
00092         // Create one of each kind of unit, and cache them in a hash
00093         registerUnit(new MillisecondUnit,       gensym("ms"));
00094         registerUnit(new MillisecondUnit,       gensym("millisecond"));
00095         registerUnit(new SecondUnit,            gensym("s"));
00096         registerUnit(new SecondUnit,            gensym("second"));
00097         registerUnit(new SampleUnit,            gensym("sample"));
00098         
00099         // Now that the cache is created, we can create a set of default units
00100         setInputUnit(neutralUnit);
00101         setOutputUnit(neutralUnit);
00102 }
00103

00105 TimeDataspace::~TimeDataspace()
00106 {
00107         ;
00108 }
